pages.text: Tegeolepis is an almost 1 meter long actinopterygian fish from the Devonian period. It was one of the earliest actinopterygians and was a free swimming predator, with its slender body build and pointed head. It was found in the Cleveland Shale of Ohio, the same locality where Dunkleosteus was found.
